channel.title: Tender twigs
channel.description:
This series discusses problems affecting today's youth, such as mental health, delinquency, crime, social pressures. It also considers solutions for parents and youths to employ.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: That which divides, destroys
item.description: Robert H. Scott, Assistant Director in the Youth Division, Michigan Dept. of Corrections, points to the effects of playing up differences between people and groups.
item.dc:creator: Wayne, Wayne C.
item.dc:subject: Youth

item.title: An eye for an eye
item.description: Dr. Garrett Heyns, Director of Institutions for the State of Washington, expresses his opinions on how we can help those who err.
item.dc:creator: Wayne, Wayne C.
item.dc:subject: Youth

item.title: A hand of help
item.description: Mark Beach, Program Director of the McGregor Fund, reviews the functions and purposes of private foundation capital, and how it may be used to aid our youth.
item.dc:creator: Wayne, Wayne C.
item.dc:subject: Youth

item.title: Man for himself
item.description: Dr. Erich Fromm, author and psychoanalyst, concludes series with discussion of the cultural pressures of our time and how we must learn, not in any selfish sense, to be for ourselves.
item.dc:creator: Wayne, Wayne C.
item.dc:subject: Youth

item.title: A school's role
item.description: Dr. William Kvaraceus, Boston University, reviews the role of the school as it relates to youth and the community.
item.dc:creator: Wayne, Wayne C.
item.dc:subject: Youth

item.title: Juvenile delinquency
item.description: Dr. James J. Brennan, Michigan State University, traces the trends of police and community programs in their effectiveness in the prevention of delinquency.
item.dc:creator: Wayne, Wayne C.
item.dc:subject: Youth

item.title: "Style of life" makes a man
item.description: Dr. Albert Cohen, author, "Delinquent Boys - The Culture of the Gang," examines delinquency and crime as results of subcultural groupings within modern society.
item.dc:creator: Wayne, Wayne C.
item.dc:subject: Youth

item.title: Teacher's influence never ends
item.description: Dr. Alice Keliher, New York University, recounts an experience of boys of the "8th Street Gang" as they prepared for a "rumble," or gang war.
item.dc:creator: Wayne, Wayne C.
item.dc:subject: Youth

item.title: Those who serve
item.description: Dr. Joseph Lohman, sociologist and Sheriff of Cook County, Illinois, discusses the roles of agents and agencies in the changing urban populations.
item.dc:creator: Wayne, Wayne C.
item.dc:subject: Youth

item.title: Community is home away from home
item.description: Vincent Reis, Minnesota Youth Conservation Commission Director in the area of Prevention and Parole, focuses on the problem of community awareness in creating a better setting for youth development.
item.dc:creator: Wayne, Wayne C.
item.dc:subject: Youth

item.title: Controls from within
item.description: Dr. David Wineman, co-author, "Controls from Within," illustrates the self-discipline factors that emerge in normal development.
item.dc:creator: Wayne, Wayne C.
item.dc:subject: Youth

item.title: Love is not enough
item.description: Dr. Bruno Bettleheim, of the University of Chicago, views parental discipline in its proper and improper use.
item.dc:creator: Wayne, Wayne C.
item.dc:subject: Youth

item.title: The greater generation
item.description: Dr. Ernest Ligon, Union College, Schenectady, New York, describes the unlimited potential of youth, and how church and/or parents can aid youth in understanding and utilizing their potential.
item.dc:creator: Wayne, Wayne C.
item.dc:subject: Youth
